headline.main: White House Ends 40-Year-Old Ban on the Use of Cameras, to Delight of Tourists
headline.print_headline: To Delight of Tourists, White House Ends 40-Year-Old Ban on Photos

byline.original: By NICHOLAS FANDOS and GARDINER HARRIS

docs.abstract: Obama administration announces end of 40-year-old ban on photography during public tours of White House; move draws widespread praise and is likely to spread of positive images of first family and increased transparency around their lives.
docs.lead_paragraph: Cellphone cameras and compact still-photo cameras with lenses no longer than three inches will be allowed during tours on Wednesday and thereafter.
docs.snippet: Cellphone cameras and compact still-photo cameras with lenses no longer than three inches will be allowed during tours on Wednesday and thereafter....

docs.abstract: The Verizon Center "kiss cam" failed to elicit a smooch from the Obamas the first time around, but on the second try the president obliged.

headline.main: After Broadway, Obamas Turn to Washington Theater

docs.abstract: The Obamas turn their attention from Broadway to theater closer to home.
docs.lead_paragraph: Having shined a White House spotlight on Broadway over the last year, President Obama and First Lady Michelle Obama are turning their attentions to theater closer to home. Arena Stage, the 60-year-old theatrical company in Washington, announced Thursday that the Obamas would be the honorary chairpeople for its inaugural 2010-11 season at its new home, the Mead Center for American Theater, in Southwest Washington. The Obamas will also serve as honorary chairs for an Oct. 25 black-tie dinner  to celebrate Arena's move into the Mead Center.
docs.snippet: The Obamas turn their attention from Broadway to theater closer to home....

docs.abstract: Sarah Obama, elderly Kenyan stepgrandmother of Sen Barack Obama, chases off burglars trying to steal solar panel from roof of her home in rural village in western Kenya (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: Sarah Obama, the elderly Kenyan stepgrandmother of Senator Barack Obama, does not have much, but what little she has was nearly stolen on Wednesday. She woke up early that morning to people stomping on her roof, according to a Kenyan police spokesman, Eric Kiraithe. Apparently some young men from her village in rural western Kenya were trying to pry off her solar panel, one of her prized possessions. Ms. Obama, about 86, and some other relatives chased the burglars away and the police later arrested four men.

headline.main: 2011 White House Security Breach Left Obamas Angry at Secret Service
headline.print_headline: 2011 White House Security Breach Left Obamas Angry at Secret Service

docs.abstract: Washington Post reports that Pres Obama and First Lady Michelle Obama were angry at Secret Service for way it handled 2011 incident in which gunman Oscar Ramiro Ortega-Hernandez fired shots that hit White House while one of their daughters was at home; report comes eight days after Omar J Gonzalez jumped the White House while armed with knifeand managed to make his way through the front door before being stopped.
docs.lead_paragraph: Three years before an armed man climbed a fence and reached the White House entrance, shots fired at the White House were dismissed as backfire.
docs.snippet: Three years before an armed man climbed a fence and reached the White House entrance, shots fired at the White House were dismissed as backfire....
